intro: Clusia ibiapabensis, commonly known as the Ibiapá Clusia, is a flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It is a member of the Clusiaceae family, characterized by its evergreen leaves and showy, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are thick and glossy, often with a waxy coating, and it produces fleshy, orange-red berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a threatened species and is of interest in botanical conservation efforts.
